tweet: Alabama’s automotive industry has made incredible progress over the past decade. Read here to learn more about the growth of major automakers within our state. Looking forward to continuing on this path for another decade. https://www.al.com/business/2019/12/a-decade-after-decline-alabamas-automakers-are-booming.html?outputType=amp …

Wishing you all a very merry Christmas today. I hope everyone is spending this time with family, friends, and loved ones. Have a wonderful holiday season and a happy new year! pic.twitter.com/SM4A050fdE

The Senate has passed HR1158 by 81-11. Finally we've secured funding for our military. We've worked tirelessly to advance these bills & I'm proud of our end result– the completion of the FY20 process. Thank you to my good friend @SenatorLeahy for his help.  https://www.appropriations.senate.gov/news/fy20-national-security-appropriations-package-passed-by-senate …

The deepening & widening of the Port of Mobile has the ability to transform AL's economy for generations to come. Proud that new dredging funds are included in HR1865 & look forward to the immeasurable impact this project will have on AL once completed. https://www.shelby.senate.gov/public/index.cfm/newsreleases?ID=58DEE3CC-9383-4969-A3EE-5476F1572733 …

From investing in AL's #infrastructure & supporting #agricultural development to funding groundbreaking medical research, the 1st FY20 appropriations measure addresses important priorities. Proud of this bipartisan agreement & look forward to its impact. https://www.shelby.senate.gov/public/index.cfm/newsreleases?ID=99A95FE0-EEE9-431D-A809-E45E0F2864B9 …

The Senate passed H.R. 1865, an appropriations package including funds for critical domestic & int'l assistance priorities. Pleased that as a result of our bipartisan efforts, we were able to come to an agreement & send these bills to the President’s desk.  https://www.appropriations.senate.gov/news/senate-passes-fy20-domestic-appropriations-package …

Whenever Speaker Pelosi decides to fulfill her Constitutional duty & transmit the articles of impeachment to the Senate, I will sit as a juror & carefully consider any evidence presented to reach a conclusion based on the facts – as outlined in our Constitution.

Over the last 12 wks, House Dems engineered a political circus & distracted us from the important work we’re here to accomplish for the American ppl. Their impeachment effort was rushed, unfair, & careless – & their decision to impeach POTUS last night seems completely unfounded.

This week I joined a resolution with several of my colleagues honoring the victims of the tragic shooting at Naval Air Station Pensacola. The measure passed the Senate today. We'll never forget their service to our nation & the lives they saved by giving their own.

Another victory for Alabama! The FY20 Agriculture appropriations bill includes a provision to ensure disaster relief funds that are set to expire at the end of 2019 remain available to assist agricultural producers who have been affected by natural disasters in recent years.

Big win for AL’s fisheries! The FY20 CJS appropriations legislation contains $5 million to continue to delegate the management of #redsnapper to the Gulf States and $5 million to develop an independent estimate of the abundance of greater amberjack in the Gulf of Mexico.
Excellent news for @UofAlabama! This year’s CJS appropriations bill contains $34.5 million to support staffing & operations at @NOAA’s @NWSNWC there. Look forward to the impact these funds will have.

Big win: This year’s #THUD appropriations bill contains $30 million for Alabama’s Appalachian Development Highway System. Proud to have worked to secure this funding to improve AL’s highway #infrastructure.

#AL remains on the forefront of space exploration! The FY20 CJS appropriations measure contains $2.586 billion for @NASA_SLS, along with an additional $44.1 million for the lunar lander office at @NASA_Marshall to lead the support of @NASA’s accelerated exploration timeline.
Great news for @AuburnU! The FY20 Homeland Security appropriations legislation contains $15.3 million for its Explosive Detection Canine Program. Proud to have secured this important funding.

Major victory in this year’s Homeland Security appropriations bill! The measure contains $150 million that will support new @USCG helicopter hulls to be produced in #Troy. Looking forward to watching this project come to fruition.

.@UABnews Clinical & Translational Sciences Award program continues to thrive! The FY20 Labor-HHS appropriations bill contains over $578 million in funding for CTSA. Look forward to watching this program improve patient and community health.

Huge news for @NIH! The FY20 Labor-HHS appropriations bill contains $41.7 billion for #NIH to conduct cutting-edge medical research to find cures for deadly diseases. Excited to see the life-saving discoveries that will stem from this funding.

BIG NEWS: The Senate will soon vote on two FY2020 appropriations packages containing major victories for #Alabama and the nation. I am proud to have secured this important funding for a host of projects that will benefit our state. Here are a few things included in the bills:

News from the @WhiteHouse: @POTUS has announced his intent to nominate Anna Manasco of #Birmingham to serve as a District Judge for the Northern District of #AL. Anna is an impressive nominee, & I am confident that, if confirmed, she will work to uphold the rule of law.

Exciting news! Science & technology leader, @LeidosInc, just announced its decision to acquire #Huntsville’s @Dynetics. Look forward to the cutting-edge national security & defense work, including hypersonics, space solutions, & more, which will result from this new relationship.

The Senate just passed the FY2020 #NDAA, which contains victories for Alabama & our men and women in uniform. This is an important step. Looking forward to securing funding for @DeptofDefense through the appropriations process as soon as possible. https://www.shelby.senate.gov/public/index.cfm/newsreleases?ID=4E466E0B-8678-4B93-878B-C44F868E7460 …

In the wake of the devastating storms that passed through Alabama yesterday, my prayers remain with the families of those who lost their lives and those who were injured. For those impacted and still in need of assistance, please visit @AlabamaEMA: https://ema.alabama.gov/

Big news for Jack Edwards National Airport in #BaldwinCounty! The airport is now eligible for funding as a part of the @FAANews Contract Tower Program. This has the ability to boost the economy of Alabama’s Gulf Coast for years to come.

Humbled to receive the UAB President’s Medal at today’s commencement ceremony. It is an honor to represent such a distinguished institution and join the list of renowned recipients awarded in years prior. I am proud to continue supporting medical research & programs at @UABNews. pic.twitter.com/7hEyGJnnHL

This is a day to recognize how far we have come, while also looking to the promising future we have ahead of us. I am proud of my state and all we have accomplished – today and every day. Happy 200th birthday, Alabama! Here's to many more. #AL200 pic.twitter.com/rbHH3qTu8n

Today we celebrate 200 years of the great state of Alabama. I am honored to have served the state over the years, watching Alabama transform into an epicenter for national defense, space exploration, manufacturing, medical research, and so on. #AL200

Today, on the 383rd birthday of the @USNationalGuard, we honor and celebrate the oldest military force in the @DeptofDefense. We remain grateful to those who serve and have served to keep us safe both at home and abroad. https://twitter.com/USNationalGuard/status/1205506487474368514 …

Today @SenDougJones & I proudly introduced a resolution that passed the Senate recognizing the 200th anniversary of the entry of #Alabama into the Union as the 22nd state. What better time to remember Alabama's history & celebrate all we have accomplished! https://www.shelby.senate.gov/public/index.cfm/2019/12/shelby-jones-honor-alabama-bicentennial-with-senate-resolution …
Joshua Watson died a hero, saving the lives of countless others. My prayers remain with his loved ones during this tragic time.

As we reflect on the horrific act of terrorism at Naval Air Station Pensacola, I want to take the time to commend & honor the brave young Alabamian, Joshua Kaleb Watson – a recent graduate of the @NavalAcademy & an Enterprise native – who was sadly one of the victims.

Important day for @NASA_SLS! @NASA’s @JimBridenstine unveiled the assembled core stage of #SLS for the first #Artemis mission. Proud to see significant progress in the process of sending humans back to the Moon and beyond. https://twitter.com/JimBridenstine/status/1204038164731584512 …

The shooting of Officer Billy Clardy III last night is a devastating tragedy for the entire community. My prayers remain with his loved ones & the Huntsville Police Department during this time of mourning. His many years of honorable service to our nation will never be forgotten.

Today is an exciting day for rural AL! @USDA has granted $62.3 million for rural broadband in the state, improving connectivity for more than 8,000 rural households, 57 farms, 44 businesses, 17 educational facilities, 14 critical community facilities, & 3 health care facilities.

Had the honor of introducing Judge Andrew Brasher in his @SenJudiciary Committee hearing to serve as Circuit Judge on the US Court of Appeals for the Eleventh Circuit. Proud of his dedication to the rule of law, and it is my hope that the committee will advance his nomination. pic.twitter.com/tznYLCiRB5

Great news! Austin Huffaker of #Montgomery was just confirmed 89-4 by the full Senate to serve as a US District Judge for the Middle District of #AL. I know he will uphold the rule of law with the utmost integrity & honor. https://www.shelby.senate.gov/public/index.cfm/2019/12/shelby-applauds-austin-huffaker-s-confirmation-as-u-s-district-judge-in-alabama …

This evening, the Senate invoked cloture by an overwhelming vote of 88-4 on the nomination of Austin Huffaker of #Montgomery to be a U.S. District Judge for the Middle District of Alabama. I look forward to confirming him to this judgeship tomorrow afternoon.

Today in the Senate we took the time to honor @SenatorIsakson for his 15 years of dedicated service to Georgia and the nation. It has been a true honor to serve with him. He will be greatly missed in the US Senate, and I wish him all the best.
